main.docTitle: Control of Obscene and Indecent Articles Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Control of Obscene and Indecent Articles Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Fees
section.content: A fee specified in an item in the Schedule shall be payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter specified in that item.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Waiver of fees
section.leadIn: The Registrar may waive in whole or in part any fee specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: item 1, 2 or 3 of the Schedule where he is of the opinion that the article to which the fee relates has educational or scientific or other benefit to the public or any part of the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: item 1 of the Schedule where the application to which the fee relates is one of 2 or more applications received by the Registrar at one time from one person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: item 2 of the Schedule where the notice to which the fee relates is one of 2 or more notices received by the Registrar at one time from one person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: item 3 of the Schedule where the request to which the fee relates is one of 2 or more requests received by the Registrar at one time from one person; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: item 4 or 6 of the Schedule where he is of the opinion that the purpose for which the search to which the fee relates is made has educational or scientific or other benefit to the public or any part of the public,

section.continued: and, in each case where the Registrar waives such a fee, he shall record in writing the reason therefor.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees payable to adjudicators
section.leadIn: For every day on which an adjudicator serves as a member of the Tribunal, the adjudicator is to be paid a fee of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the service on that day is for less than half a day—$530.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Manner of giving notice under section 18
section.leadIn: A notice of classification required in respect of any article by section 18(1) of the Ordinance shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing in English and Chinese;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the title and description of the article;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the classification of the article and the date on which that classification took effect; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any conditions imposed under section 8(2)(c) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II article, state in full the provisions of sections 22, 24 and 27 of the Ordinance, for which purpose copies of those sections may be attached to the notice; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be given not later than the time of publication of a third copy of the article to the person to whom the notice is required by section 18(1) of the Ordinance to be given.
